definition: to ascend/to rise to the rank of/to promote/to hoist/liter/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth dou 斗[dou3]

sentences.english: As Dante climbed through a hierarchy of heavens, he ascended a hierarchy of rank.
sentences.chinese: 但丁最終攀上了九重天堂，他擢升的是地位層級。

sentences.english: He was my mentor and under him I have been rapidly promoted.
sentences.chinese: 他是我的輔導人，在他手下，我擢升很快。

sentences.english: Enhance the newly-weds taste of jewelry and watches by serving as reference for both appreciation and guidance.
sentences.chinese: 從欣賞性和指導性起程擢升新人認識珠寶腕錶的價值。

sentences.english: Because of his outstanding contributions to the project, the board promoted him to vice president.
sentences.chinese: 由於在這個項目中貢獻突出，他被董事局擢升爲副總。

definition: select the best people for promotion
to promote to a higher job/to select for promotion
to transfer/to move to another post
to seal up (a door with a paper seal, or a document)/to confer an additional title on a nobleman
to join the nobility/to rise through the nobility
to receive fief and title/to be enfeoffed/(fig.) to be rewarded by the emperor
appointment (to a job)/to be appointed (to high office)/to accept an appointment/entrusted with responsibilities/same as 授任
to break the rule/to make an exception
